 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְפַק‎</span> **verb** ==go, or come, out, forth== ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] ***id.***, Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָפַק‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, so Christian-Palestinian Aramaic [[BDB#Schulth|Schulth]]<sup>Lex. 126</sup>, Old Aramaic, Nabataean, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נפק‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>324</sup>, compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***hole*** of field mouse; see also Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נַפְקוּתָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***outlay***, Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נפקתה‎</span> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>Inscr. 212</sup>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***household outlay*** (Aramaic loan-word [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>ZMG iii (1898). 133</sup>)); — 

**Pe\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נ‎</span> [[Dan.2.14|Dan 2:14]] ***he went out***, with infinitive; 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נֶפְקַת‎</span> v[[Dan.2.13|Dan 2:13]] decree ***went forth*** (compare [[Luke.2.1|Luke 2:1]]); 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נפְקַו‎</span> [[Luke.5.5|Luke 5:5]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] ([[BDB#Qr|Qr]] 3 feminine plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְפַ֫קָה‎</span>, [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 23, 2</sup>) fingers ***came forth***; with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִן‎</span> local: ***Imperative*** masculine plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פֻּקוּ‎</span> ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 42</sup>) [[Luke.3.26|Luke 3:26]] ***come forth! Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נָָֽפְקִין‎</span> v[[Luke.3.26|Luke 3:26]] (both of men); singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נָפֵק‎</span> [[Luke.7.10|Luke 7:10]] (= ***flow out***). **Haph\`el** ***bring forth***, accusative of thing + <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִן‎</span> local: ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הַנְפֵּק‎</span> [[Ezra.5.14|Ezra 5:14]] (twice in verse); [[Ezra.6.5|Ezra 6:5]]; [[Dan.5.2|Dan 5:2]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הַנְפִּ֫קוּ‎</span> v[[Dan.5.3|Dan 5:3]] (so Egyptian Aramaic [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap. D 15, 17</sup>+).
